column1: #Text=Massive flooding in China ; over 550 thousand evacuated
#Text=The course of the Yangtze River , China 's largest , from north to south .
#Text=Heavy June rainfall has forced China to evacuate more than 550,000 people from their homes .
#Text=Massive floods have devastated the central and southern parts of the country , causing rivers to overflow their banks and triggering mudslides .
#Text=The rains follow the worst drought in China in over 50 years , which has decimated crop yields .
#Text=Since June 13 , the damage caused by the rainstorms has led to ... the emergency evacuation of 671,200 people to safety .

#Text=Overall , 40 rivers have risen above safe limits , stressing dykes and dams including those on China 's largest waterway , the Yangtze River , which is flooding downstream while experiencing a severe drought near its source in the north .
#Text=China 's disaster level has been raised to four , the highest on the scale .

#Text=In a statement on its website on Friday , China 's Ministry of Civil Affairs said , " Since June 13 , the damage caused by the rainstorms has led to ... the emergency evacuation of 671,200 people to safety .
